availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Lancaster, Pennsylvania, soldier. Gettysburg, Pennsylvania native. Son of Emanuel N. Gerhart and Eliza Gerhart. Graduated from Franklin and Marshall College in Lancaster. Served in the Nevinâ€™s Pennsylvania Volunteer Light Artillery Regiment (U.S.A.) as first sergeant and second lieutenant from July 2, 1861. Served in the 121st United States Colored Infantry Regiment as major from July 25, 1865 to June 30, 1865. Served in the 125th United States Colored Infantry Regiment as major and colonel from July 25, 1865 to December 14, 1867.
